alert.note: Alert for Calumet; Waushara; Winnebago (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 28 at 9:44PM CDT by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorma will impact portions of southwestern Calumet, Winnebago and southeastern Waushara Counties through 1030 PM CDT... At 944 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Berlin, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Oshkosh, Redgranite, Central Lake Winnebago, Rush Lake, Northern Lake Winnebago, Omro, Winneconne, Eureka, Brothertown and Stockbridge. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Green Bay. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for central and east central Wisconsin.
